page.title: 18FARMING AROUND LAMLASH.
page.content: A study made on the type of farming in Lamlash shows that the two main arable crops are Barley and Grass.The grass is used as silage for the livestock. The livestock is made up of dairy cattle.These provide the necessary milk supply for Arran.When the cows are milked,the milk is transported by a milk tanker to be processed and pasteurised in the neighbouring village of Brodick.Once it has been pasteurised it is put into 1 pint plastic cartons to be distributed around the island. There is one other crop that is grown,which is potatoes but they are sold commercially by the farmers,and are used for a low cost food source by the farmer and his family.
